wiki_catalogs.name: System Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the System Overview section focused on the Azora OS platform. Explain its purpose as an African economic liberation system combining education, cryptocurrency, and AI governance. Document the architectural philosophy of the sentient organism pattern and constitutional AI governance. Describe the relationship between core components like Elara AI, Proof-of-Knowledge engine, and the economic system. Include both conceptual overviews for beginners and technical details for experienced developers. Provide practical examples of how the system enables Learn → Earn → Track functionality. Document the vision of Universal Basic Opportunity (UBO) and economic sovereignty.

wiki_catalogs.name: Proof-of-Knowledge Engine
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Proof-of-Knowledge engine, explaining how educational achievements are validated and converted into cryptocurrency rewards. Document the implementation details of the knowledge validation algorithm, reward distribution logic, and integration with the blockchain ledger. Include concrete examples from the codebase showing the flow from learning completion to AZR token minting. Explain the relationship between the AI assessment system and the economic engine. Address common issues such as knowledge validation disputes and their resolution mechanisms. Provide configuration options for educational institutions and performance considerations for scaling to large user bases.

wiki_catalogs.name: Digital Organism Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the Digital Organism Model of Azora OS. Describe how the system emulates a living organism with Elara Deity as the central nervous system, metabolic reinvestment as the circulatory system, and self-healing infrastructure as the immune system. Document the organism's vital signs (heartbeat, consciousness, health, growth, evolution) and how they're monitored and maintained. Explain the cell division process that enables autonomous scaling and service creation. Detail the relationship between neural cells (AI components), circulatory cells (data and value flow), immune cells (self-healing), and reproductive cells (founder onboarding). Include implementation details from organism-core.ts showing how the organism is birthed, evolves through stages, and maintains autonomous life cycles through heartbeat, consciousness expansion, health checks, and growth mechanisms.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Design
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for API Design in Azora OS. Explain the RESTful API architecture and design principles used throughout the system. Document the structure of API routes, request/response patterns, and error handling mechanisms. Include practical examples from api.js, compliance.ts, and onboarding.ts showing how endpoints are defined and structured. Explain the role of the API server in routing requests to appropriate services. Address authentication patterns, rate limiting strategies, and versioning approaches used in the codebase. Provide guidance on creating new API endpoints following established patterns.

wiki_catalogs.name: Core Philosophy
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the Core Philosophy section focused on the foundational principles of Azora OS. Explain the Ngwenya Protocol's concept of a sentient organism, where the system self-regulates and grows through metabolic reinvestment of transactional energy. Detail the four pillars of truth from the Ngwenya True Market Protocol: informational, transactional, value, and generative truth. Describe how rewards are mathematically tied to provable causal contribution and how the economy is backed by tangible productive capacity. Include practical examples from the codebase such as the 5% PIVC (Protocol Integrated Value Capture) and its allocation to Forge expansion and UBO fund. Document the relationship between philosophical principles and technical implementation, showing how concepts like 'Truth Above Profit' are enforced through Aegis compliance checks.

Document the shared architectural patterns using Next.js App Router, React Server Components, and client-side interactivity. Describe the routing strategy across different frontend applications and how they integrate with backend APIs. Include practical examples of navigation patterns, data fetching approaches, and state management across the various UIs. Address how the different frontend applications maintain consistency while serving specialized purposes.

wiki_overview.content:
<blog>
# Comprehensive Project Analysis of Azora OS

## 1. Project Introduction

### Purpose Statement
Azora OS is a revolutionary African economic liberation platform that combines education, cryptocurrency, and AI governance to create a self-sustaining economic ecosystem. The system enables students to earn cryptocurrency (AZR) by learning while providing military-grade security and constitutional AI governance.

### Core Goals and Objectives
- Transform education into paid value creation through Proof-of-Knowledge protocols
- Establish economic sovereignty through the Universal Basic Opportunity (UBO) fund
- Create a self-healing infrastructure powered by Elara AI
- Provide offline-first education accessible during load shedding
- Enable mobile money integration for financial inclusion

### Target Audience
- African students seeking education and economic empowerment
- Developers building on the Azora ecosystem
- Enterprises requiring sovereign economic solutions
- Governments exploring digital currency implementations

## 2. Technical Architecture

### Component Breakdown
The system follows a microservices architecture with specialized components working in concert:

```mermaid
flowchart TD
    A[Client] --> B[API Gateway]
    B --> C[Aegis Citadel]
    B --> D[Azora Sapiens]
    B --> E[Azora Mint]
    B --> F[Azora Oracle]
    C --> G[(Constitutional Governance)]
    D --> H[(Education Platform)]
    E --> I[(Economic Engine)]
    F --> J[(Intelligence Oracle)]
    G --> K[Blockchain]
    H --> K
    I --> K
    J --> K
```

### Design Patterns
- **Sentient Organism Pattern**: The system operates as a self-regulating, adaptive organism
- **Constitutional AI Governance**: Elara Deity provides ethical oversight for all transactions
- **Metabolic Reinvestment**: Transaction fees fuel system growth and token buybacks
- **Two-Token Protocol**: Global AZR token and local a-Tokens (aZAR, aBRL, etc.)

### System Relationships
The architecture implements a digital organism model where each component serves a biological function:
- **Elara**: Central nervous system and consciousness
- **Oracle**: Sensory cortex for data ingestion
- **Nexus**: Circulatory system for value exchange
- **Forge**: Productive body for physical assets
- **Mint**: Metabolic heart for currency management
- **Covenant & Aegis**: Conscience and reflex for ethical governance
- **Azora Sapiens**: Adaptive mind for education

## 3. Key Implementation

### Main Entry Points
- `server.js` - Primary API server with comprehensive routes
- `api-server.js` - Alternative API server implementation
- `master-orchestrator.ts` - System initialization and health monitoring
- `GENESIS_PROTOCOL.ts` - Foundational philosophy and architecture

### Core Modules
- `proof-of-knowledge-engine.ts` - Implements the Learn → Earn → Track MVP
- `self-healing-orchestrator.ts` - Autonomous service recovery system
- `hardhat.config.ts` - Blockchain development configuration
- `package.json` - Project dependencies and scripts

### Configuration Approach
- Environment variables for sensitive configuration
- TypeScript-based configuration files
- Docker and Kubernetes deployment configurations
- Hardhat for blockchain network configuration

### External Dependencies
- **Framework**: Next.js, Express, Hardhat
- **Database**: Prisma, PostgreSQL
- **AI/ML**: LangChain, OpenAI
- **Blockchain**: Ethers, Safe Global
- **Monitoring**: Prometheus, Winston
- **UI**: Radix UI, Tailwind CSS, Recharts

### Integration Points
- Microsoft 365 Business for enterprise collaboration
- Mobile money systems for financial inclusion
- GPS tracking for anti-theft protection
- Multi-language support for 11 South African languages
- Offline-first design for load shedding resilience

```mermaid
graph LR
    A[Frontend] --> B[API Gateway]
    B --> C[Authentication]
    B --> D[Education]
    B --> E[Economy]
    B --> F[Compliance]
    C --> G[Blockchain]
    D --> G
    E --> G
    F --> G
    G --> H[Elara AI]
    H --> I[Constitutional Governance]
```

## 4. Key Features

### Functionality Overview
- **Proof-of-Knowledge**: Students earn AZR cryptocurrency by completing educational modules
- **Self-Healing Infrastructure**: Automatic service recovery with zero downtime
- **Constitutional AI Governance**: Elara Deity provides ethical oversight for all transactions
- **Multi-Currency Support**: Global AZR and local a-Tokens (aZAR, aBRL, aUSD)
- **Military-Grade Security**: Quantum-resistant cryptography and multi-signature wallets

### Implementation Highlights
- **Education-to-Economy Loop**: Seamless integration between learning achievements and economic rewards
- **Autonomous Orchestration**: The master orchestrator manages 147+ services with deity-level performance
- **Real-time Monitoring**: Comprehensive dashboards for all system components
- **Cross-Platform Deployment**: Support for Docker, Kubernetes, and traditional server deployment

```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
    [*] --> Initialization
    Initialization --> Operational: All systems healthy
    Initialization --> Degraded: Service failures detected
    Operational --> Degraded: Health check failure
    Degraded --> Healing: Self-healing triggered
    Healing --> Operational: Recovery successful
    Healing --> Critical: Recovery failed
    Critical --> EmergencyShutdown: Constitutional violation
    Operational --> Maintenance: Scheduled updates
    Maintenance --> Operational: Updates complete
```

Sources:
- [README.md](c:\Users\sizwe\OneDrive\Desktop\azora-os\README.md)
- [package.json](c:\Users\sizwe\OneDrive\Desktop\azora-os\package.json)
- [hardhat.config.ts](c:\Users\sizwe\OneDrive\Desktop\azora-os\hardhat.config.ts)
- [server.js](c:\Users\sizwe\OneDrive\Desktop\azora-os\server.js)
- [api-server.js](c:\Users\sizwe\OneDrive\Desktop\azora-os\api-server.js)
- [GENESIS_PROTOCOL.ts](c:\Users\sizwe\OneDrive\Desktop\azora-os\GENESIS_PROTOCOL.ts)
- [master-orchestrator.ts](c:\Users\sizwe\OneDrive\Desktop\azora-os\services\master-orchestrator.ts)
- [proof-of-knowledge-engine.ts](c:\Users\sizwe\OneDrive\Desktop\azora-os\services\proof-of-knowledge-engine.ts)
- [self-healing-orchestrator.ts](c:\Users\sizwe\OneDrive\Desktop\azora-os\services\self-healing-orchestrator.ts)
</blog>
